• Drinking Age 21
 • Weed is legal in only some states, check the specific state for regulations
 • Alcoholic Beverages can’t be in public
 • Driving on the right side of the road
 • Different states have different laws
 • Jaywalking is illegal
 • Smoking is against the law in most public places
 • Sometimes public spaces will have designated smoking areas

• Tipping culture: At the end of meals customers are expected to tip their waiter.
 • 15% = General Minimum/Satisfied
 • 18% = Very Satisfied
 • 20+%= Great Service!
 • When you go to restaurants it is not uncommon to not have specific ingredients in your dish, it is ok to ask the waiter to withhold these ingredients.

• In the U.S fork, knives and spoon are the customary utensils. It’s a good idea to learn other manners associated with these utensils.
 • Slurping, and Burping during meals is frowned upon.
 • While with friends, you will most likely split the bill. Generally the times when only one person pays for the bill is for special occasions, or if they insist.

• It is frowned upon to spit on the ground
 • Direct eye contact is okay and sometimes encouraged, just don’t stare too hard
 • Gift giving is not common when someone invites you to their home unless it is some sort of special event, then a small gift such as wine is acceptable.
 • Being on time and/or early is very important in american culture

• In the south people are more likely to go out of their way to hold doors for people.
 • Different parts of the U.S have vastly different slang words
 • Tap water tastes different between states
 • Tap water is free in restaurants!
 • Since there is a drought in california you have to ask for water, they don't just offer it to you.
 • It’s generally okay to walk inside people’s houses with your shoes on.
